<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module8_mcq_q98')" data-correct-answer="C">
<strong style="display: block;">A firm has debt of $400 million at an interest rate of 6% and faces a corporate tax rate of 25%. If the government limits the deductibility of interest to 70% of total interest expense, what is the value of the firm’s annual tax shield?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q98" value="A"> A. $18 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q98" value="B"> B. $20 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q98" value="C"> C. $4.2 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q98" value="D"> D. $6.0 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q98" value="E"> E. $10.5 million</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module8_mcq_q98" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: C.  
Interest = 400 × 6% = 24 million  
Deductible portion = 70% × 24 = 16.8 million  
Tax shield = 16.8 × 0.25 = **$4.2 million**.
</div>

:::
